# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `mi_ha`
* Variable label: `Myocardial infarction or heart attack`
* Variable description: `Myocardial infarction or heart attack since the last wave`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | No
1        | Yes

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `mi_ha_age`
* Variable label: `Age of each episode of myocardial infarction or heart attack`
* Variable description: `Age of each episode of myocardial infarction or heart attack`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
cont_label <- cat_label[3:11]

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `PTOLDHRT == 0 or (PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `mi_ha == 0 into 996`
* `if mi_ha == 1 mi_ha_age = age - (PHRTYEAR - 1)*5 (if PHRTYEAR == 3, age-10; if PHRTYEAR == 2, age-5; if PHRTYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo cuba_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_cuba_w1$id))
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0

# There are 2 individuals which specify heart attack in PHRTWHAT and answer PHRTYEAR, while they answer no to PTOLDHRT. We harmonize them as having a heart attack
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTWHAT==1 & (t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT!=1 | is.na(t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT)))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_cuba_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_cuba_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_cuba_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTYEAR[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTYEAR)  & t1066_cuba_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript cuba_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(mi_ha))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha_age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(mi_ha_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(55,100)+scale_y_continuous(breaks=c(0,2,4,6,8,10))

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation cuba_w1, echo=F}

X <- table(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$mi_ha, useNA = "ifany")
dichotomous <- c(X[1],sum(X[2:3]))
C <- rbind(continuous,dichotomous)
colnames(C) <- c("0<-->996","1<-->(possibly missing) age of diagnostic")
kable(C,caption = "Continuous vs Dichotomous")

```



#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `f_PTOLDHRT == 0 or (f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, mi_ha_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and in w1, mi_ha_age from w1`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `mi_ha == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo cuba_w2}


# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w2$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$id))
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$f_PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$f_PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1


# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$id))
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$age != 999)] <- t1066_cuba_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$age != 999)] - (t1066_cuba_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$age != 999)] - t1066_cuba_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$mi_ha==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$age != 999)])/2





```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation cuba_w2, echo=F}

  sum(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$f_PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)),na.rm=T),
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `PTOLDHRT == 0 or (PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `mi_ha == 0 into 996`
* `if mi_ha == 1 mi_ha_age = age - (PHRTYEAR - 1)*5 (if PHRTYEAR == 3, age-10; if PHRTYEAR == 2, age-5; if PHRTYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo UCh_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UCh_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_UCh_w1$id)
t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_UCh_w1$id))
t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_UCh_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_UCh_w1$PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_UCh_w1$PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_UCh_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_UCh_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0


# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UCh_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UCh_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_UCh_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_UCh_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UCh_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_UCh_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_UCh_w1$PHRTYEAR[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UCh_w1$PHRTYEAR)  & t1066_UCh_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `f_PTOLDHRT == 0 or (f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and in w1, mi_ha_age from w1`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `mi_ha == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo UCh_w2}



# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UCh_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_UCh_w2$id)
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$id))

t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_UCh_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_UCh_w2$f_PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$id))
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha==1)] <- t1066_UCh_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha==1)] - (t1066_UCh_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha==1)] - t1066_UCh_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$mi_ha==1)])/2
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `f_PTOLDHRT == 0 or (f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, mi_ha_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and in w1, mi_ha_age from w1`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `mi_ha == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo RCh_w2}



# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RCh_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_RCh_w2$id)
t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RCh_w2$id))
t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_RCh_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_RCh_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_RCh_w2$f_PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_RCh_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_RCh_w2$f_PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1

# There is an individual which specifies heart attack in f_PHRTWHAT, while it answers no to f_PTOLDHRT We harmonize it as having a heart attack
t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_RCh_w2$f_PHRTWHAT==1 & (t1066_RCh_w2$f_PTOLDHRT!=1 | is.na(t1066_RCh_w2$f_PTOLDHRT)))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RCh_w2$id))
t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha==1)] <- t1066_RCh_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha==1)] - (t1066_RCh_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha==1)] - t1066_RCh_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w2$mi_ha==1)])/2


```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `PTOLDHRT == 0 or (PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `mi_ha == 0 into 996`
* `if mi_ha == 1 mi_ha_age = age - (PHRTYEAR - 1)*5 (if PHRTYEAR == 3, age-10; if PHRTYEAR == 2, age-5; if PHRTYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo DR_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_DR_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_DR_w1$id)
t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_DR_w1$id))
t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_DR_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_DR_w1$PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_DR_w1$PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_DR_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_DR_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0


# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_DR_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_DR_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_DR_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_DR_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_DR_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_DR_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_DR_w1$PHRTYEAR[which(t1066_ds_DR_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_DR_w1$PHRTYEAR)  & t1066_DR_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `PTOLDHRT == 0 or (PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `mi_ha == 0 into 996`
* `if mi_ha == 1 mi_ha_age = age - (PHRTYEAR - 1)*5 (if PHRTYEAR == 3, age-10; if PHRTYEAR == 2, age-5; if PHRTYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo Ven_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_Ven_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_Ven_w1$id)
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_Ven_w1$id))
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_Ven_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_Ven_w1$PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_Ven_w1$PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_Ven_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_Ven_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0

# There is an individual which specifies heart attack in PHRTWHAT and answers PHRTYEAR, while it answers no to PTOLDHRT. We harmonize it as having a heart attack
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_Ven_w1$PHRTWHAT==1 & (t1066_Ven_w1$PTOLDHRT!=1 | is.na(t1066_Ven_w1$PTOLDHRT)))] <- 1


# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_Ven_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_Ven_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_Ven_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_Ven_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_Ven_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_Ven_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_Ven_w1$PHRTYEAR[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_Ven_w1$PHRTYEAR)  & t1066_Ven_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `f_PTOLDHRT == 0 or (f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, mi_ha_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and in w1, mi_ha_age from w1`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `mi_ha == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo Ven_w2}



# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_Ven_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_Ven_w2$id)
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$id))
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_Ven_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_Ven_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_Ven_w2$f_PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_Ven_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_Ven_w2$f_PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$id))
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha==1)] <- t1066_Ven_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha==1)] - (t1066_Ven_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha==1)] - t1066_Ven_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$mi_ha==1)])/2


```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `f_PTOLDHRT == 0 or (f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, mi_ha_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and in w1, mi_ha_age from w1`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `mi_ha == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo UP_w2}



# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UP_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_UP_w2$id)
t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UP_w2$id))
t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_UP_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_UP_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_UP_w2$f_PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_UP_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_UP_w2$f_PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UP_w2$id))
t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha==1)] <- t1066_UP_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha==1)] - (t1066_UP_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha==1)] - t1066_UP_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_UP_w2$mi_ha==1)])/2
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `PTOLDHRT == 0 or (PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `mi_ha == 0 into 996`
* `if mi_ha == 1 mi_ha_age = age - (PHRTYEAR - 1)*5 (if PHRTYEAR == 3, age-10; if PHRTYEAR == 2, age-5; if PHRTYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo RP_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RP_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_RP_w1$id)
t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_RP_w1$id))
t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_RP_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_RP_w1$PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_RP_w1$PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_RP_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_RP_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0


# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RP_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RP_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_RP_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_RP_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RP_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_RP_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_RP_w1$PHRTYEAR[which(t1066_ds_RP_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RP_w1$PHRTYEAR)  & t1066_RP_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `PTOLDHRT == 0 or (PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `mi_ha == 0 into 996`
* `if mi_ha == 1 mi_ha_age = age - (PHRTYEAR - 1)*5 (if PHRTYEAR == 3, age-10; if PHRTYEAR == 2, age-5; if PHRTYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo UM_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UM_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_UM_w1$id)
t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_UM_w1$id))
t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_UM_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_UM_w1$PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_UM_w1$PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_UM_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_UM_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0


# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UM_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UM_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_UM_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_UM_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UM_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_UM_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_UM_w1$PHRTYEAR[which(t1066_ds_UM_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UM_w1$PHRTYEAR)  & t1066_UM_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `mi_ha == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo UM_w2}



# Categorical variable harmonization

t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha[which(t1066_UM_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_UM_w2$f_PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UM_w2$id))
t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha==1)] <- t1066_UM_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha==1)] - (t1066_UM_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha==1)] - t1066_UM_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_UM_w2$mi_ha==1)])/2
```

```{r harmo RM_w1}
# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RM_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_RM_w1$id)
```

* `if mi_ha == 1 in w2 and in w1, mi_ha_age from w1`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `mi_ha == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo RM_w2}

t1066_ds_RM_w2$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$mi_ha==1)] <- t1066_RM_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$mi_ha==1)] - (t1066_RM_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$mi_ha==1)] - t1066_RM_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$mi_ha==1)])/2
```

| **Label** | `told had heart problem?` |`what was the heart problem?`|`when told heart problem?`|`age`|
| **Table name**  | `1066-PuertoRico-Baseline` | `1066-PuertoRico-Baseline` | `1066-PuertoRico-Baseline` |`age`|
| **Categories** | `0 = no`<br/>`1 = yes` |`1 = heart attack`<br/>`2 = angina`<br/>`3 = heart failure`<br/>`4 = valve problem`<br/>`5 = other` |`1 = 0-5 years ago`<br/>`2 = 5-10 years ago`<br/>`3 = more than 10 years ago`|`continuous`|
| **Missings** | `NA` | `NA` | `NA` |  |
| **Description** |  |  |  |  |

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 1 into 1`
* `PTOLDHRT == 0 or (PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 2 or 3 or 4 or 5) into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `mi_ha == 0 into 996`
* `if mi_ha == 1 mi_ha_age = age - (PHRTYEAR - 1)*5 (if PHRTYEAR == 3, age-10; if PHRTYEAR == 2, age-5; if PHRTYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo PR_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_PR_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_PR_w1$id)
t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha <- rep(999,length(t1066_PR_w1$id))
t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_PR_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_PR_w1$PHRTWHAT == 1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_PR_w1$PTOLDHRT==0 | (t1066_PR_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_PR_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(2,3,4,5)))] <- 0

# There is an individual which specifies heart attack in PHRTWHAT and answers PHRTYEAR, while it answers no to PTOLDHRT. We harmonize it as having a heart attack
t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha[which(t1066_PR_w1$PHRTWHAT==1 & (t1066_PR_w1$PTOLDHRT!=1 | is.na(t1066_PR_w1$PTOLDHRT)))] <- 1


# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_PR_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha_age[which(t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_PR_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_PR_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_PR_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_PR_w1$PHRTYEAR) & t1066_PR_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_PR_w1$PHRTYEAR[which(t1066_ds_PR_w1$mi_ha == 1 & !is.na(t1066_PR_w1$PHRTYEAR)  & t1066_PR_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```

```{r descript PR_w1, echo=F}
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)

pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_ds_PR_w1, aes(mi_ha_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(50,100)+scale_y_continuous(breaks=c(0,2,4,6,8,10))
```
